intro: Paratropia terebinthinacea, commonly known as the Mediterranean terebinth, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 2 to 3 meters and has leathery, oval-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy fruits that turn red when mature. It is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions. The species is also known for its aromatic leaves and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
